instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had liquid damage. Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and surrounding corroded components. After doing this I had a fan spin for a few minutes. Not sure what happened but when I plug it in now I hear a small clicking sound and the green light blinks rapidly but no fan spin.

I now only have 11.82V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS voltage without battery? Green light present? <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS 11.82V without battery. Green light present but flickers everu other second . <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> present 2.56V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: 11.8 is no good must be 12.23 or 12.56. Check resistance between pins 17/18 27/28 on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, also check <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: That's diode mode we want resistance mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin
threads.message: Those measurements don't make sense. .21 is 21 Ohm? Now I'm doubting that 11.8v too.
